measured_by: story-based adoption scenario choice task (selecting between high-cost vs low-cost objects)
justification: "In each trial, they were told a story about a child who obtained two identical objects-one easy to obtain and the other difficult ... Choosing the high-cost object would suggest that participants expect others to value these objects more than low-cost alternatives."

measured_by: story-based prediction task in the future-cost condition (choosing which object to retrieve)
justification: "In the future costs condition ... the character was faced with a choice between an object that would be costly to retrieve and one that would be less costly to retrieve, and children were asked which object the character would retrieve."

measured_by: first-person story choice task (child as protagonist choosing between previously obtained high- vs low-cost objects)
justification: "Children were tested in a single condition in which they heard two stories where they were the protagonist ... 'Your teacher says that you can only bring one rock home. Which rock will you bring home?'"

topic_or_construct: interpersonal sensitivity to others’ sunk costs
measured_by: interpersonal sunk cost choice task (choosing between objects collected with differing effort by two other characters)
justification: "Two characters collected objects ... one of the characters worked harder to collect their item than the other ... Children decided which of the two objects they would keep."
